elements.title: George W. Munroe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Broadway and vaudeville star George W. Munroe (pictured) was known for his comic female impersonations of elderly Irish women?

elements.title: Frank J. Wood Bridge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Frank J. Wood Bridge is the seventh bridge built across the Androscoggin River to link the towns of Brunswick and Topsham, Maine, since 1796?

elements.title: Yuki Sakakihara (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that singer and voice actor Yuki Sakakihara lived "[so] deep in the mountains of Okayama Prefecture" that it was difficult for him to go out for karaoke?

elements.title: Battle of La Haye-du-Puits (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that at the Battle of La Haye-du-Puits in July 1944, a Confederate flag dating to the American Civil War was raised over the town?

elements.title: Drew Golz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Drew Golz, who was Baseball Academic All-American of the Year and Soccer Academic All-American of the Year, became the first male student athlete to be named Academic All-American of the year for two sports at the same time?

elements.title: Czechoslovak Gendarmerie (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that four members of the interwar Czechoslovak Gendarmerie were killed in action against the Sudetendeutsches Freikorps during the Clash at Habersbirk?

elements.title: Liberty 5-3000 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that scholars have called Liberty 5-3000, the heroine of Ayn Rand's Anthem, "an ideal Randian" and "a frivolous trophy wife"?

elements.title: CSL Plasma (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that many employees of CSL Plasma are themselves plasma donors?

elements.title: Bittersweet Goodbye (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Issey Cross's 2023 song "Bittersweet Goodbye" uses a sped-up sample of a sped-up sample of a sped-up cover version, which itself interpolates a cover version of a traditional gospel song?
